criteria.armPosition: Arm in fixed position of choice, no hands have contact to the pole
criteria.legPosition: Inside leg is wrapped, outside leg is bent backwards

criteria.armPosition: Basic or cup grip
criteria.legPosition: Both legs are fully extended in straddle position with lower foot floor based and the arch of the upper foot is in contact with the pole
criteria.bodyPosition: Torso is extended away from the pole

criteria.armPosition: Inside arm holds outside foot, outside arm is in fixed position of choice with no contact with the pole
criteria.legPosition: Inside leg is wrapped, outside leg is betn backwards

criteria.armPosition: Arms in fixed position of choice, no hands have contact to the pole
criteria.legPosition: Inside leg is wrapped, outside leg is bent backwards

criteria.armPosition: Basic or cup grip
criteria.legPosition: Both legs are fully extended in straddle position with lower foot floor based. The arch of the upper foot is in contact with the pole
criteria.bodyPosition: Torso is extended away form the pole

criteria.armPosition: Inside arm grips the pole above the inside leg. Outside arm is extended in a fixed position of choice
criteria.legPosition: Frontal split position with both legs fully extended
criteria.bodyPosition: Back arch, facing away from the pole

criteria.armPosition: Inside arm has contact with the pole. No hands have contact with the pole
criteria.legPosition: Both legs are fully extended in straddle position

pointsOfContact: Ankles (not hte arch of the foot)
criteria.armPosition: Basic or cup grip
criteria.legPosition: Both legs are fully extended in straddle position
criteria.bodyPosition: Upper body must be at 90° angle to the pole

pointsOfContact: top of foot of lower leg
criteria.armPosition: Basic grip
criteria.legPosition: Both legs are fully extended in split position

criteria.armPosition: Inside arm grips the pole, above the inside leg. Outside arm is extended in a fixed position of choice
criteria.legPosition: Frontal split position with both legs fully extended

criteria.armPosition: Inside hand grips pole, above inside leg, outside arm is extended and hand is holding the ankle/shin of the outside leg
criteria.legPosition: Split position with inside leg fully extended, outside leg bent backwards

criteria.armPosition: Grip of choice, arms are fully extended
criteria.legPosition: Both legs are fully extended
criteria.bodyPosition: Inverted. Back arched with hips and both legs parallel to the floor

criteria.armPosition: No hands have contact with the pole. The same arm holds the ankle/shin of back leg and is fully extended. The opposite arm holds front leg
criteria.legPosition: Splut position with front leg fully extended, back leg bent

pointsOfContact: Ankles (not the arch of the foot)
criteria.armPosition: Elbow grip
criteria.legPosition: Both legs fully extended in straddle position
criteria.bodyPosition: Upper body must be at 90° angle to the pole

criteria.armPosition: Only one hand has contact with the floor, the other is holding the ankle of the front leg. Floor based arm is fully extended
criteria.legPosition: Both legs are fully extended in a vertical split position
criteria.bodyPosition: Handstand position (hips above the head and above the shoulders in a straight line)

pointsOfContact: Ankles (not the arch of the foot)
criteria.armPosition: Basic or cup grip
criteria.legPosition: Both legs are fully extended in straddle position
criteria.bodyPosition: Upper body must be at 90° angle to the pole

criteria.armPosition: Grip of choice, bottom arm is fully extended
criteria.legPosition: Both legs are fully extended in split position

criteria.armPosition: Basic or cup grip
criteria.legPosition: Both legs are fully extended and closed
criteria.bodyPosition: Back arch with hips and both legs parallel to the floor

criteria.armPosition: Underarm and/or hand
criteria.legPosition: Both legs are fully extended and parallel to the pole with feet above the head

criteria.armPosition: Arms are fully extended, inside arm is in underarm grip, hands holding legs at the ankle/shin level
criteria.legPosition: Both legs are bent annd thighs are parallel to the floor or higher than hips
criteria.bodyPosition: Upper body is upright, hips facing the floor

criteria.armPosition: Inside hand grips pole above the inside leg. Outside arm is extended and holding the ankle/shin of outside leg
criteria.legPosition: Inside leg is fully extended. Outside leg is bent backwards

criteria.armPosition: Underarm or bicep of inside arm has contact with the pole. Inside arm is fully extended. Outside arm holdinng ankle of inside leg. No hand contact with the pole
criteria.legPosition: Both legs are fully extended inn split position

criteria.armPosition: Basic or cup grip
criteria.legPosition: Both legs are fully extended inn frontal split position in contact with the pole
criteria.bodyPosition: Upper body (torso and head) must be at 90° angle to the pole

criteria.armPosition: Split arm position. Inside forearm wraps around inside leg and holds the pole. Outside hand holds pole above head
criteria.legPosition: Both legs are fully extended in split position

criteria.armPosition: Underarm or bicep of inside arm has contact with the pole. Inside arm is fully extended. Outside arm holding ankle of inside leg. No hand contact with the pole
criteria.legPosition: Both legs are fully extended in a frontal split position and parallel to the floor

criteria.armPosition: No hands have contact with the pole. Arms are fully extended above the head in ring position and holding foot of outside leg
criteria.legPosition: Inside leg is wrapped, both legs are bent

criteria.armPosition: Basic or cup grip, holding the pole at the hip
criteria.legPosition: Both legs are fully extended in split position

criteria.armPosition: Outside arm in fixed position of choice. No hand contact with the pole
criteria.legPosition: Both legs are fully extended inn split position

criteria.armPosition: Arms are fully extended in split grip
criteria.legPosition: Legs are in position of choice, on the same side of the pole as the body
criteria.bodyPosition: Upright, upper body is in back arch

pointsOfContact: Forearm and hand of lower arm
criteria.grip: Top arm is in elbow grip, bottom arm is in holding onto the pole
criteria.armPosition: Top arm is holding the thigh of the back leg around the pole. Bottom arm is in holding onto the pole
criteria.legPosition: Both legs are fully extended in a frontal split positionn

criteria.armPosition: Split grip
criteria.legPosition: Both legs are fully extended in split position of choice

criteria.armPosition: Inside hand grips pole above inside leg. Outside arm is extended and holding the anckle/shin of the outside leg
criteria.legPosition: Both legs are fully extended in a frontal split position

criteria.armPosition: No hands have contact with the pole, the same arm holds the ankle/shin of the back leg and is fully extended. The oposite arm holds front leg
criteria.legPosition: Split position with front leg fully extended and the back leg bent

criteria.armPosition: Underarm or bicep of inside arm has contact with the pole. Inside arm is fully extended and holding foot or ankle of opposite leg. Outside arm holding ankle of inside leg. No hand contact with the pole
criteria.legPosition: Split position with innside leg fully extended and the back leg bent. The line of the legs is parallel to the floor

criteria.armPosition: Arms are fully extended above the head in ring positionn and holding back leg
criteria.legPosition: Split position with front leg gripping the pole at the knee, back leg is fully extended

criteria.armPosition: Arms are fully extended, inside hand holding the inside leg at the shin level (between knee and ankle). Outside hand has contact with the floor.
criteria.legPosition: Both legs are fully extended in split position. Innside foot has contact with the floor

criteria.armPosition: Only one hand has contact with the floor. The other is holding the ankle of the front leg. Floor based arm is fully extended
criteria.legPosition: Both legs are fully extended in a vertical position
criteria.bodyPosition: Handstand position (hips above the head and shoulders in a straight line

criteria.armPosition: Underarm, Hands holding legs at the knee
criteria.legPosition: Both legs are fully extended with feet above the head
criteria.bodyPosition: Upper body is upright, hips facing the floor

criteria.armPosition: Basic or cup grip
criteria.legPosition: Both legs are fully extended in split position
criteria.bodyPosition: Upper body must be at 90° angle to the pole and facing downwards

criteria.armPosition: Inside arm is fully extended and holds the pole. Outside hand holds opposite ankle
criteria.legPosition: In a split / oversplit; Front leg has no contact with the pole, and both legs arefully extended
criteria.bodyPosition: Upright, facing away from the pole

criteria.armPosition: Arms can be bent. No hands have contact with the pole. Hands are holding foot/ankle of back leg
criteria.legPosition: Front leg is wrapped, back leg and foot must be stretched over the head or in a ring position

criteria.armPosition: Outside hand has no contact with the pole and is holding the opposite leg
criteria.legPosition: Both legs are fully extended in split position and parallel to the pole

compulsories.name: Back split to pole ring position

criteria.armPosition: Basic or cup grip
criteria.legPosition: Split position with front leg fully extended. Back leg bent, foot must touch head

criteria.armPosition: Both arms are bent and above the head, hands are clasped behind the head
criteria.legPosition: Both legs are fully extended in a diagonal split

criteria.armPosition: No hands to have contact with the pole. The inside arm holds back leg at ankle/shin level and is fully extended. The outside arm holds front leg.
criteria.legPosition: Both legs are fully extended inn split position

criteria.armPosition: Underarm or bicep of inside arm has contact with the pole. Inside arm is fully extended. Outside arm holding ankle of inside leg. No hand contact with the pole
criteria.legPosition: Both legs are fully extended in split position and parallel to floor

criteria.armPosition: Inside arm is fully extended and in contact with the pole. Outside arm holds the pole behind the back
criteria.legPosition: Both legs are fully extended in front split position and parallell to the floor

pointsOfContact: Crook of elbow of one arm
criteria.armPosition: Upper arm holds pole in the crook of the elbow, and holds upper leg. Lower arm is fully extended and holds the pole
criteria.legPosition: Both legs extended in split position

criteria.armPosition: No hands have contact with the pole. Elbow grip hand holding ankle of opposite leg. Free arm is in fixed position of choice annd has no contact with the pole
criteria.legPosition: Both legs are fully extended in a frontal split position

pointsOfContact: Hand and forearm of lower arm
criteria.grip: Upper hand in cup grip, lower arm is forearm grip
criteria.armPosition: Both arms are bent. Outside arm is wrapped around the inside leg and holds the pole above the inside leg
criteria.legPosition: Both legs are fully extended in a diagonal split position and at 45° angle to the pole

pointsOfContact: Lower arm/elbow (upper arm has no contact with the pole)
criteria.armPosition: Both arms are bent. Hands ar clasped behind the inside leg and back
criteria.legPosition: Both legs are fully extended in a horizontal split position

criteria.armPosition: Underarm or bicep of inside arm has contact with the pole. Inside arm is fully extended and holding foot or ankle opposite leg. Outside hand is holding ankle/shin of inside leg. No hand contact with the pole
criteria.legPosition: Frontal split position with front leg fully extended and parallel to the floor, back leg is bent

criteria.armPosition: No hands have contact with the pole, arms are fully extended above the head in ring position and holding foot of outside leg
criteria.legPosition: Both legs are bent, back foot is over the head

pointsOfContact: Back of shoulder of inside arm
criteria.armPosition: Outside arm in fixed position of choice. No hand contact with the pole. inside arm wraps around pole and leg
criteria.legPosition: Both legs are fully extended insplit position in alignment with the pole

criteria.armPosition: Basic or cup grip
criteria.legPosition: Split position with front leg bent. Back leg fully extended

criteria.armPosition: Arm holding upper leg is in an elbow grip, lower arm holds pole in forearm grip
criteria.legPosition: Both legs are fully extended in a diagonal split

compulsories.name: Split grip leg through frontal split

criteria.armPosition: Split grip
criteria.legPosition: Both legs are fully extended in split position
criteria.bodyPosition: Upper body (torso annd head) is parallel to the floor

criteria.armPosition: Both arms are fully extended, same hand holds same leg at shin level (between ankle and knee), no hands have contact with the pole
criteria.legPosition: Back leg is fully extended, other leg is in passé

pointsOfContact: Ankles to the pole (not the arch of the foot)
criteria.armPosition: No hand contact with the pole. Both arms ahould be extended
criteria.legPosition: Both legs are fully extended in straddle position
criteria.bodyPosition: Upper body (torso and head) must be at 90° angle to the pole, chest facing upwards

criteria.armPosition: both arms are bent, hands are clasped behind the head
criteria.legPosition: Both legs are fully extended in a diagonal split position

pointsOfContact: Knee and shin of upper leg
criteria.armPosition: Arms are fully extended in wide basic grip. Upper hand grips the pole above the same leg at shin level. Lower hand grips the pole below the lower leg at thigh level.
criteria.legPosition: Legs are fully extended

criteria.armPosition: Arms are fully extended above the head in ring position and holding back leg
criteria.legPosition: Split position with front leg grippinng the pole at the knee, back leg fully extended

criteria.armPosition: Inside arm is fully extended and in contact with the pole, outside arm holds the pole behind the back
criteria.legPosition: Fang position with both legs bent back, toes touch the shoulder or the crown of head

criteria.armPosition: Arms are fully extended, inside hand has contact with the pole, back of arm has contact with the inside leg. Outside hand has contact with the floor.
criteria.legPosition: Both legs are fully extended in split position
criteria.startingPosition: From the floor (refer to the glossary)

criteria.armPosition: Hand of bottom arm is in contact with the floor and arm is fully extended, top arm holds onto same leg
criteria.legPosition: Both legs are extended in a split position, in a straight line, and only the foot of one leg in contact with the pole. Legs are parallel to the floor.
criteria.bodyPosition: Torso is at 90° angle to the pole

compulsories.name: Iguana elbow hold split no hands

criteria.armPosition: One arm is holding the pole behind the body at the elbow. the other arm is fully extended and holding back leg at shin level (between knee and ankle)
criteria.legPosition: Both legs are fully extended in split position and horizontal

criteria.armPosition: Both arms are bent, one hand holds pole, other hand holds opposite leg extended to the front at the ankle or calf
criteria.legPosition: Both legs are fully extended in split position, in a straight line

criteria.armPosition: Basic or cup grip
criteria.legPosition: Both legs are fully extended in split position. Leg with contact with the pole is parallel to the floor, no tolerance.

criteria.armPosition: Both arms are bent and hands are clasped, only top arm has contact with the pole
criteria.legPosition: Both legs are fully extended, split angle at a 45° angle to the floor
criteria.bodyPosition: Inverted, full body is at 45° angle to the floor

criteria.armPosition: Arms are fully extended. One hand has contact with the pole, the other hand has contact with the floor.
criteria.legPosition: Both legs are fully extended in a split position

criteria.grip: Inside arm: underarm grip. Outside arm: basic or cup grip
criteria.armPosition: Outside arm wraps around the inside leg and holds the pole at the ankle of opposite foot, inside arm is around the pole and leg, with the underarm in contact with the pole
criteria.legPosition: Both legs are fully extended in a frontal split position, foot of outside leg should be holding the pole from behind. The front leg is the inside leg, the back leg is the outside leg.

criteria.armPosition: No hands have contact with the pole, arms are fully extended and hands are holding foot/ankle of back leg
criteria.legPosition: Front leg is wrapped, back leg and foot must be stretched over the head or in a ring position

criteria.armPosition: Elbow holds pole behind the back, other hand holds opposite leg
criteria.legPosition: Both legs are fully extended in split position and parallel to the pole

criteria.armPosition: Both hands hold the pole behind the legs
criteria.legPosition: Both legs are fully extended in split position
criteria.bodyPosition: Upper body is in a back arch

compulsories.name: Back split overhead hold on pole

criteria.armPosition: Both arms are fully extended and hands hold the pole above the head at ankle/calf height
criteria.legPosition: Both legs are fully extended in split position

criteria.armPosition: Both arms fully expended and holding the pole above the head
criteria.legPosition: One leg grips the pole in the crook of the knee and along the back of the thigh. The other leg is crossed over the first leg
criteria.bodyPosition: Inverted, facing away from the pole

criteria.armPosition: One hand is holding the pole, the other arm is fully expended
criteria.legPosition: Inside leg is in passé, outside leg is fully extended and parallel to the floor. Both legs are on same side of the pole.
criteria.bodyPosition: Hips are parallel to the floor

criteria.armPosition: Arms can be bent and hold the pole behind the body
criteria.legPosition: Both legs are bent and thighs are in contact with the torso

criteria.grip: Top hand is in cup grip
criteria.armPosition: Both arms are fully extended
criteria.legPosition: Both legs are fully extended in split position
criteria.bodyPosition: Inverted. Heel of oposite to the top hand is on the pole, creating a twist in the hip

criteria.armPosition: Flag grip
criteria.legPosition: Upper leg is fully exptended, lower leg is in passé
criteria.bodyPosition: Upper body and leg are parallel to the floor

criteria.armPosition: Forearm grip
criteria.legPosition: Both legs are fully extended in either straddle or pencil position

pointsOfContact: Inside leg (No foot or ankle contact)
criteria.armPosition: Armns in fixed position of choice with no contact with the pole or the body
criteria.legPosition: Outside leg is fully extended, inside leg is bent, position is held through pressure of the inside leg against the pole, and is not hooked at the knee
criteria.bodyPosition: Angled, head downwards towards the floor

criteria.armPosition: One arm is extended with the hand holding the opposite leg (which is wrapped around the pole), other arm si in fixed position of choice
criteria.legPosition: One leg fully extended, other leg is bent around the pole

criteria.armPosition: One arm is extended and holding the pole above the head, other arm is inn elbow grip
criteria.legPosition: Both legs are fully extended in straddle position

criteria.armPosition: Top arm in elbow grip, bottom arm is bent annd holding the pole
criteria.legPosition: Upper leg is fully extended and parallel to the floor
criteria.bodyPosition: Entire body is parallel to the floor

criteria.armPosition: Flag grip
criteria.legPosition: Both legs are fully extended and closed

compulsories.name: Back support plank outside leg passé
Iguana elbow hand straddle no hands
One shoulder side plank legs open
Split grip reverse plank legs open
One shoulder side plank legs closed

criteria.armPosition: Both arms are fully extended. Inside arm is at the bottom, outside arm is at the top
criteria.legPosition: Both legs are fully extended, parallel to the floor. Hips and legs are closed
criteria.bodyPosition: Entire body is facing downwards, at 90° angle to the pole

criteria.armPosition: Both arms are fully extended. Inside arm is at the top, outside arm is at the bottom

criteria.bodyPosition: Entire body is facing downwards, at 90° angle to the pole

criteria.armPosition: Split grip
criteria.legPosition: Starting in an upright position of choice, extend away from the pole. Perform a complete 360° rotation of the entire body (legs, hips and torso) above the head, to return to the starting position, and repeat.
Diamond
Both legs are fully bent and are in contact with the pole at the ankles
Dimond

Chair position at 90° angle
Legs are in attitude position, parallel to the floor

Legs are in attitude position, parallel to the floor

criteria.holdPosition: Minimum 360° rotation in the final position
criteria.armPosition: Reverse spin starting with one arm on the pole into a split grip
criteria.legPosition: Legs are in attitude in the final position
criteria.bodyPosition: Upright at an angle away from the pole

criteria.armPosition: Both arms are fully extended
criteria.legPosition: Diamond

criteria.armPosition: Both arms extended
criteria.legPosition: Both legs fully extended and closed in pike position, parallel to the floor
Tucked around the pole

criteria.armPosition: Inside hand ahs contact with the pole
criteria.legPosition: Both legs are in attitude
Both legs are fully extended in straddle position
criteria.bodyPosition: Upper body is parallel to the floor

criteria.armPosition: Reverse spin starting with one arm on the pole into a twisted grip hand position

criteria.legPosition: Both legs are fully extended in straddle position, then pencil

criteria.armPosition: Arm are bent

criteria.armPosition: Top arm fully extended, bottom arm may be slightly bent
criteria.legPosition: Both legs fully extended and closed
criteria.bodyPosition: Extended in a pencil position at an angle away from the pole

criteria.holdPosition: Minimum 360° rotation, where the rotation must be maintained until the butterfly extension is fully extended
criteria.legPosition: Tuck position followed by split position
criteria.bodyPosition: Criteria of Cradle spin (ST12) and Butterfly extension (S18) apply

criteria.armPosition: Reverse spin starting with one hand on the pole, hand re-grips the pole and reverse spin is repeated without making contact with the pole
criteria.legPosition: Legs in fixed position of choice
criteria.bodyPosition: Upright at an angle away from the pole

criteria.armPosition: Reverse spin starting with one arm on the pole into a twisted grip handspring without making contact with the floor
criteria.legPosition: Legs finish in a fixed position of choice
criteria.bodyPosition: Body moves into inverted position after handspring

criteria.bodyPosition: Upright at an angle away from the pole

criteria.armPosition: Criteria for double reverse grab body sprial 1 applies (ST21). Finishing in a twisted grip dead lift handspring without making contact with the floor
criteria.legPosition: Fixed leg position of choice

criteria.legPosition: Legs finish in a fixed position of choice

criteria.holdPosition: Minimum 720° rotation, where the handspring should still spin
criteria.grip: Cup grip - in pencil with both hands, only with top hand in inverted position

criteria.legPosition: Spin begins in pencil (see ST19 for minimum criteria) and finishes in a fixed leg position of choice
criteria.bodyPosition: Pencil position for spin, inverted for final position

criteria.holdPosition: Minimum 720° rotation, where the handspring should still spin
criteria.armPosition: Criteria of Double reverse grab body spiral 2 applies (ST23), finishing in a twisted grip lift handspring without making contact with the floor

Thighs are parallels to the florr and legs closed

criteria.armPosition: Both arms are holding the ankle of the inside leg
criteria.legPosition: Both legs are fully extended in split position

criteria.armPosition: Inside arm is extended and in contact with the pole. Outside arm is in a fixed position of choice with no contact with the pole
criteria.legPosition: Both legs are fully extended and closed in pencil position
criteria.bodyPosition: Upright, away from the pole, parallel to the pole

criteria.armPosition: Inside arm fully extended and in contact with the pole. Outside arm in a fixed position of choice with no contact with the pole
criteria.legPosition: Fully extended and closed

criteria.armPosition: Cross grip
criteria.legPosition: Both legs are fully extended and closed, parallel to the floor

criteria.armPosition: No hand contact, both arms are fully extended
criteria.legPosition: Both legs are fully extended, parallel to the floor, hips are legs are closed
criteria.bodyPosition: Entire body (head to feet) is straight at a 90° to the pole, with a tolerance of not more than 20°

criteria.armPosition: Inside arm is fully extended and in contact with the pole. Outside arm is bent, holding the opposite leg above the head
criteria.legPosition: Both legs are fully extended in split position, parallel to the pole
criteria.bodyPosition: Upright, away from the pole, parallel to the pole

criteria.armPosition: Split grip
criteria.legPosition: Starting in an upright position, legs and hips make a circular rotation (fan kick/flair), passing through an inverted position with the hips above the head, ending in pike position (jack knife) over the head for 2 times

criteria.armPosition: Inside arm is fully extended, and the triceps has contact with the pole. Outside arm is in fixed position of choice with no contact with the pole
criteria.legPosition: Fully extended and closed

pointsOfContact: Crook of the knee of the bottom leg
criteria.armPosition: Upper hand holds pole above shin of upper leg, Lower hand holds pole below the lower thigh
criteria.legPosition: Lower leg must be extended, with shin of the top leg is in contact with the pole
criteria.bodyPosition: Upright, facing away from the pole

pointsOfContact: Foot and shin of same leg
criteria.armPosition: Both arms are fully extended. Inside hand is holding the pole above the head, the outside hand is holding the same ankle/shin level
criteria.legPosition: Both legs are fully extended. Foot and shin of inside leg have contact with the pole, outside leg is extended to the back
criteria.bodyPosition: Inverted and suspended away from the pole, back is in a back arch
